alert.note: Alert for Benton; Jasper; Lake; Newton; Porter (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 18 at 4:25AM EST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...Blowing Snow Likely in Open Areas this Afternoon and Tonight... * WHAT...At least patchy blowing and drifting snow caused by wind gusts of 30 to 40 mph over freshly fallen snow cover. * WHERE...Open or rural areas of Northern Illinois and northwest Indiana. * WHEN...Developing early this afternoon and persisting through tonight. * IMPACTS...Lightly snow covered roads in places due to blowing and drifting snow, making for patches of hazardous travel. West to east roads would be most susceptible through early evening. Reduced visibility, possibly sharply in places. * CONFIDENCE...While some blowing snow is expected, there is uncertainty with how widespread this will be in open areas. A Winter Weather Advisory may be issued if it appears this will become more widespread and hazardous. * ACTIONS...Allow extra travel time and expect varying road conditions and also possibly visibility in open areas.
